--- title: Model Inspector keywords: fastai sidebar: home_sidebar summary: "Inspect machine learning models" description: "Inspect machine learning models" nb_path: "index.ipynb" ---
{% raw %}
{% endraw %}

Install

pip install model_inspector

How to Use

Example:

{% raw %} 
from IPython.display import HTML
import sklearn.datasets
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression

from model_inspector.sklearn import generate_linear_model_html
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
diabetes = sklearn.datasets.load_diabetes()
X, y = diabetes["data"], diabetes["target"]

HTML(
    generate_linear_model_html(
        model=LinearRegression().fit(X, y),
        feature_names=diabetes["feature_names"],
        target_name="progression",
    )
)
progression = 152.13 - 10.01 * age - 239.82 * sex + 519.84 * bmi + 324.39 * bp - 792.18 * s1 + 476.75 * s2 + 101.04 * s3 + 177.06 * s4 + 751.28 * s5 + 67.63 * s6
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
HTML(
    generate_linear_model_html(
        LinearRegression().fit(X, y), diabetes["feature_names"], "progression"
    )
)
progression = 152.13 - 10.01 * age - 239.82 * sex + 519.84 * bmi + 324.39 * bp - 792.18 * s1 + 476.75 * s2 + 101.04 * s3 + 177.06 * s4 + 751.28 * s5 + 67.63 * s6
{% endraw %}

The library also supports logistic regression with model_inspector.sklearn.generate_logistic_model_html.
